<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hammer Quake](/Feats.aspx?ID=6371) <actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Flourish" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=606" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 207 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Mauler](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=256)

**Prerequisites**
[Mauler Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6368)

**Requirements**
You’re wielding a non-[finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602)  melee weapon in two hands.

</column>

---

You smash the ground with your weapon, knocking nearby creatures to the ground. Choose a square within your reach, including your own space. If there’s an enemy in the chosen square, you can [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306) that enemy with your two-handed weapon. Regardless of whether you attempted a Strike, you then attempt to [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=2382) every enemy in the chosen square plus each square adjacent to that square, ignoring Trip’s requirement that you have a hand free.

Hammer Quake counts as three attacks toward your [multiple attack penalty](/Rules.aspx?ID=2289), but the penalty doesn’t increase until after you’ve made the Strike, if any, and all the Trip attempts.
name: Hammer Quake
requirement: You’re wielding a non- finesse   melee weapon in two hands.
